sentence.Network_en: Ian kneed him in the groin.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊恩用膝盖顶他的下身。

sentence.Network_cn: 他痛惜他四年的生活就因大腿根部的伤被毁掉了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English grynde, perhaps from Old English grynde 'depression, abyss'

entry.def: Your groin is the front part of your body between your legs.

means.word_mean: 1. the crease at the junction of the inner part of the thigh with the trunk together with the adjacent region and often including the external genitals
2. a protective structure of stone or concrete; extends from shore into the water to prevent a beach from washing away
